section.heading: Tuition; disposition of fees and income

content.p:
ยง 6007. Tuition; disposition of fees and income. The state university
trustees shall regulate tuition fees and other fees and charges to be
paid by students after prior consultation with the board of trustees of
the college. All moneys received for tuition from students, those
derived from the sale of the products of property belonging to the state
administered by the college, and from fees and charges or any other
sources in the course of the administration of the college,
notwithstanding the provisions of section one hundred twenty-one of the
state finance law, shall be credited to a separate fund and shall be
expended as provided by subdivision four of section three hundred
fifty-five of this chapter.
